byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti, Yamiche Alcindor and Ari Isaacman Bevacqua contributed reporting.

abstract: Request by author Kelly Oxford on Twitter for women to tweet their experiences with sexual assault in response to release of recording of Donald Trump talking about forcing himself on women leads to overwhelming response; Facebook pages and Twitter feeds immediately fill with comments and multiplying threads from women, many who claim they had never spoken about their abuse before, retelling harrowing experiences of sexual assault, harassment and other forms of abuse.
lead_paragraph: When she first posted a message on Twitter, Kelly Oxford, a social media powerhouse, didn’t expect many replies. She got millions.
snippet: When she first posted a message on Twitter, Kelly Oxford, a social media powerhouse, didn’t expect many replies. She got millions....

headline.main: For Many Women, Trump’s ‘Locker Room Talk’ Brings Memories of Abuse
headline.print_headline: ‘Tweet Me Your First Assaults’ Sets Off a Protest Movement
